intro: Antirrhinum murale proles barrelieri, commonly known as the Barrelier's wallflower, is a rare and endemic species native to specific regions of southern Europe. It is a flowering plant characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically thrives in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in sunny, well-drained habitats. Its botanical features include lance-shaped leaves and a flowering period that occurs during the spring and early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
